div.p: Gothenburg Public Schools is joining schools across Nebraska and the nation in the “Be the Light” campaign. On Monday, April 20th at 8:20 P.M., the stadium lights will be turned on for 20 minutes to honor the Class of 2020 and those working to fight COVID- 19. Gothenburg residents and students are encouraged to drive by the stadium during that time and honk their horns in support. To comply with social distancing protocols, participants are asked to stay in their vehicles.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: The following is the newly adopted Pass/No Harm grading policy for grades 9-12 to finish out the 2020 school year. Students that work to submit an assignment with some type of good faith effort will receive a mark that meets proficiency. If a final grade on the assignment would lower their percentage grade in the class, it will be marked as EXEMPT. If nothing is ever turned in, or it is not completed in good faith, the assignment score will be marked MISSING.

Students cannot receive a lower grade than their 3rd quarter grade in PowerSchool. When students turn in assignments and those assignments are assessed and reviewed, student semester grades can only improve; their grade cannot go down. There are no penalties for late work. If a student is not turning in assignments, the first intervention should be to contact the student or family and find out why. It is the expectation of Gothenburg Public Schools that students put forth good faith effort to complete coursework in order to receive course credit.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Sports physicals on file for the 2019-2020 school year for any current 9-11 grade students will now also be valid for the 2020-2021 school year. All incoming freshmen (Current 8th graders) will still be required to provide sports physical paperwork that is dated no earlier than May 1, 2020.

The physicals that the current 7th graders have on file for the 2019-2020 school year can be used for NSAA/athletic purposes for the 2020-2021 school year. All incoming 7th graders (Current 6th graders) will need a physical for NSAA/athletic purposes.
If you have any questions, please contact Mr. Marc Mroczek, Gothenburg Public Schools Activities Director, at marc.mroczek@goswedes.org.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

h3.strong: The Gothenburg FFA Greenhouse Will Officially Open On April 18th!

div.p: Hours: Mon-Fri 4:30 pm - 6:30 pm Sat. 9:00 am -12:00 noon Sun 1:00 pm - 3:00 pm
Call 308-537-3651 ext. 3110 for greenhouse tour times every 15 minutes any days that we are open by appointment only - NO WALK-INS!
Curbside pickups and deliveries available. We will follow all CDC codes for the safety of our customers.
We will offer Venmo and will hope to have a credit card reader for payments. We will also have prices set up with tax included, this will avoid counting back change.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Gothenburg Public Schools Activities Director, Marc Mroczek, has named Kassie Schuett as the new head girls basketball coach for the 2020-2021 school year. Kassie has been the head girls basketball coach at Maxwell Public School the past three years, and prior to that she was the assistant girls basketball coach for three years. Kassie is a 2011 Maxwell Public School graduate and will be teaching 7-12 Special Education for Gothenburg Public Schools. Welcome to Gothenburg, Kassie! We are excited to have you!

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-2 term-high-school term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: The 2019-2020 yearbooks are on sale now. You can purchase your yearbook online by clicking on the picture below or stop by Mrs. Keiser's room and order yours today!

div.class: views-row views-row-7 views-row-odd cols2-col-first cols3-col-first cols6-col-first
node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Any students that need to drive with Mr. Reeves will be contacted by May 1st. Drive times will be set up depending on the COVID 19 situation in Nebraska.
You will drive when the State of Nebraska and Gothenburg Public Schools allows. If you have any questions, please contact Mr. Reeves at steve.reeves@goswedes.org.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Swede Pride, Swede Strong, and Swede Nation has never meant more than it does during this time that we are away from our Swede Family! There is nothing greater that we can give to each other than the gift of time, encouragement, and support. As we face this COVID-19 pandemic, current challenges, and challenges that are yet to come, please remember to continue to support your friends, family, and neighbors with ACT!

p.strong: A – Acknowledge. Acknowledge their concern, worries, fears, frustration, or sadness.
C – Care. Show that you care by offering support through listening and encouragement.
T – Tell. Tell a trusted adult that you have a concern so that an adult can check in with them.

div.p: Parents or students are encouraged to call or reach out to school counselors, teachers, or administrators if you need support or if you know of someone who needs additional support.
Jerry Wiggins (ext. 4124) jerry.wiggins@goswedes.org
Pam Glodowski (ext. 3134) pam.glodowski@goswedes.org
Michelle Stevens (ext. 2202) michelle.stevens@goswedes.org
Melissa Shepherd (ext. 2248) melissa.shepherd@goswedes.org

p.strong: Immediate Emergency or Immediate Safety Concern Call:

div.p: Emergency: 911
Gothenburg Police Department: 308-537-3608
Dawson County Sheriff: 308-324-3011
Nebraska Family Helpline: 1-888-866-8660

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p:
At this time, the ELEMENTARY SUMMER ART CAMP scheduled for June 15th-18th is still going on as planned. Camp will take place in the Discovery Center.
If you have not yet registered for the camp and would like to do so, please email Mrs. Stortenbecker (jami.stortenbecker@goswedes.org) and she will mail a packet as well as additional information to you. Payments will not be collected at this time. A further date will be established for when payments are due.
If you have any questions, feel free to email Mrs. Stortenbecker. Additional information may be found on the elementary art website https://gothenburgswedeselementaryart.weebly.com/.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-3 term-elementary term-2 term-high-school term-6 term-news clearfix

h2.a: Update / Important Information About The Coronavirus

span.content: Update / Important Information About The Coronavirus

h2.a: Update / Important Information About The Coronavirus

div.p: Update 4/9/20 - Click here to view the 4th Gothenburg Virtual Town Hall Meeting held on 4/9/20.

Update 4/5/20 - Good Evening. This is Dr. Rhodes, Superintendent of Gothenburg schools. This past Wednesday Governor Ricketts announced that all schools in the state of Nebraska would be closed to students through May 31st. In that regard, Gothenburg schools will remain closed through the remainder of the school year. Education for our students will continue throughout the closure using the same remote and online procedures that have been established over the last few weeks. The district will also continue to provide student meals during the closure. Our food and nutrition staff will be wearing masks for their and your protection. Please note that the student meal program will follow the school calendar. Meals will not be provided on Friday April 10th or Monday April 13th as those are listed as No School days due to Easter break. The physical closing of the school building brings on many end of the year discussions and questions, especially for those that are in their senior year. We feel so badly for the awesome Swede Class of 2020, but we will do everything possible to make-up and hold the events that are capstone events to a high school education such as prom and graduation. Both prom and graduation are currently postponed indefinitely until we get more information about how and when these events may be held from our local health department. Now here is Dr. Carol Shackleton with an important message. Community transmission of COVID-19 has been identified in several areas of the state. Community transmission is when people have COVID-19 but public health officials are unable to identify how or where they became infected. All Nebraska counties are now covered by state Directed Health Measures (DHMs) until May 11. The state Directed Health Measures: Impose a legally enforceable, 10-person limit on public gatherings. These measures also Require restaurants and bars to close their dining areas and move to takeout, delivery, and/or curbside service only. Require individuals to home quarantine for at least 14 days if: They have tested positive for COVID-19. They have a fever of 100.4° F or above. They have experienced sudden onset of a cough and/or shortness of breath. They reside or have resided with individuals who’ve tested positive for COVID-19 or have the above symptoms. Some individuals in home quarantine may not experience the onset of symptoms until the latter half of their 14-day quarantine period. In this case, the length of their quarantine may exceed 14 days. Individuals must remain in quarantine until 7 days have passed since onset of symptoms, their symptoms have improved, and they have been fever-free for at least 72 hours without the use of fever-reducing medication. The DHM’s limitation on public gatherings does not apply to: Certain retail stores such as pharmacies or grocery stores, but people must still maintain six feet of distance from one another while in these stores. For further clarification, Nebraska DHHS website has a more extensive list of examples regarding what business are and are not exempt from the DHM. As community spread of COVID-19 increases across the state, we continue to encourage you to remain vigilant in practicing strict social distancing. This is not the time to let your children have neighborhood “play dates” and “get-togethers”. Self-isolation and quarantine reminders: Remain separate from ALL individuals, wear a mask outside the home, and severely restrict all visitors to your home. Please take care of yourself and those around you. Isolation and quarantine can be very difficult, both physically and emotionally. This is not the time for criticism of those isolated. We are all in this together. As a community, let’s act as one to show we can face this pandemic responsibly and with a sense of purpose. Also I want to remind you to ‘stay calm’ and stick with it. The most important thing we can do is support each other (from a distance!) and continue to follow recommendations. It may be easy to ‘sneak’ a quick social visit, but this negates the purpose. Thank you.
Click here for previous information released by the school & community on the COVID-19.

div.class: node node-landing-page node-teaser term-6 term-news clearfix

div.p: Kindergarten Registration for the 2020-2021 school year will look a little bit different this year due to the COVID-19 school closure. Here are three links that will help with the Kindergarten Registration process.

Kindergarten Registration Presentation:
https://drive.google.com/…/1pcK-o_etM5NVPH1DZZ2nE7kdr…/view…

Kindergarten Packet:
https://drive.google.com/…/1CAjqfO7wu1vPazpfOhioG5712…/view…

Kindergarten Official Registration:
https://forms.gle/g66Daimx9hR8NSaD8
If you have questions, please contact Angie Richeson (Elementary Principal) at angie.richeson@goswedes.org or Melissa Haas (School Nurse) at melissa.haas@goswedes.org
